nodes.bodyText: Very unclear what this is used for.
Could wait for worker thread to set state and call control.onDone if true here means anything for the control ... ?
This could be called unconditionally now.
Shall it be guaranteed that onDocument is always called from a single thread in the local implementation? If not, consider adding synchronization in the data handlers here.
Well, that would have to be a set, then.

Since outstanding is a ConcurrentSkipListMap I'm presuming it operates on a logical snapshot of the set of initial document IDs where concurrent removes can't mess anything up? It's been a while since I've looked into its semantics 🙂

Its iterators are weakly consistent — while this is weakly defined, they can reflect changes during iteration.
This is the case for the last part of the unit test. I suppose this test would break, were the implementation of ConcurrentSkipListMap ever to change.
Put a guard on state being RUNNING in the iteration.

I'm one of those filthy {} lovers, so consider adding braces around at least the outer for-loop since it's easy to accidentally put things in the wrong scope when using multiple nested control flow statements
Alternatively, I see that this functionality is already provided in FieldSetRepo.copyFields
